div1.p: Marvin discusses Hench's meeting at the Walter Reed Army Medical Center.

div1.head: Letter from H.P. Marvin to Philip Showalter Hench, July 10, 1940
div1.opener:
Send L Hyg.
Walter Reed General Hospital,
Washington, D.C.
July 10, 1940.
Dr. P.S. Hench,
Mayo Clinic,
Rochester, Minn.
Dear Doctor Hench:
div1.p:
Thank you very much for your very kind letter of June 24th.
received while I was on a 3 weeks vacation at my home in Vermont, where it was
cold and rainy thruout our visit, much the opposite of the hot day that you
and Mrs. Hench came out here to Walter Reed. Moreover I shall be most happy to
receive the reprints on arthritis that you mentioned in your letter and also the
review on Walter Reed. All will be most interesting and valuable to me.

It was so good to see you again and to have the pleasure of
meeting Mrs. Hench and the 3 delightful younger Henches. General Marietta was
very pleased that you could both come out here and Mrs. Marvin and I were glad
of an opportunity to be with you. We are sorry that it did not seem an opportune
time to have dinner together but will hope that you may be here again, or at
some other place where we are located. If so please be sure to let us do anything
we can for you in any way. I can never repay you for the help and courtesy which
you extended me during our most enjoyable 3 months in Rochester. The many rounds
with you highlighted a most profitable visit to the Clinic.

Please remember me to Dr. Alvarez and Charles Watkins if you
should happen to see them anytime. With kindest wishes,
